io.atomix.copycat.client

Interface Command<T>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Operation<T>, Serializable

    public interface Command<T>
extends Operation<T>
    Raft state commands modify system state.

    Commands are submitted by clients to a Raft server and used to modify Raft cluster-wide state. The Raft consensus protocol dictates that commands must be forwarded to the cluster leader and replicated to a majority of followers before being applied to the cluster state. Thus, in contrast to cueries, commands are not dictated by different consistency levels.

    Author:
    Jordan Halterman

      • Methods inherited from interface io.atomix.copycat.client.Operation

        builder

    • Method Detail

      • consistency

        default Command.ConsistencyLevel consistency()
        Returns the command consistency level.

        The consistency will dictate the order with which commands are submitted to the Raft cluster. Ultimately, all commands are linearized by Raft. But commands submitted concurrently by a single client may be received by the cluster out of order. The consistency level allows users to specify how out-of-order commands should be handled. Consult the Command.ConsistencyLevel documentation for more information.

        By default, this method enforces strong consistency with the Command.ConsistencyLevel.LINEARIZABLE consistency level.

        Returns:
        The command consistency level.

      • persistence

        default Command.PersistenceLevel persistence()
        Returns the command persistence level.

        The persistence level will dictate how long the command is persisted in the Raft log before it can be cleaned.

        Returns:
        The command persistence level.
